messages.content:
I'm trying to say super expert engineers that are expert in their subject area or topic - i know there's a word for this can't find it:
The oversight engineer team will include a full time resident engineer assisted with specialty discipline engineers as needed and staff from then design engineer.    

help me update the sentence?
The oversight engineering team will comprise a full-time resident engineer, augmented by specialist engineers as required, along with personnel from the design engineering team.
no, more fancy high tech super specific

The oversight engineering cadre shall encompass a perennial resident engineer, complemented by an ensemble of domain-specific engineering virtuosos, in concert with the avant-garde from the design engineering consortium.

The oversight engineering team will comprise a full-time resident engineer, augmented by expertize domain-specific engineer expertise as required, along with personnel from the design engineering team. 

almost...

The oversight engineering team will be spearheaded by a full-time resident engineer, bolstered by a contingent of domain-specific engineering luminaries as needed, and supported by the adept cohort from the design engineering faction.
more professional and clear

The oversight engineering team will consist of a dedicated resident engineer, supported by specialized domain-specific engineers as necessary, alongside skilled staff from the design engineering division.

make this sound pro and unavoidable. Maybe use acronyms and jargon like DLF or something I'm not sure
Royalty fee: The royalty fee consists of a Design License Fee of 1,000,000 USD and 2,000,000 for Construction License Fee for a total lump sum of 3,000,000 USD, to be paid as follows:

Royalty Fee Obligation: The royalty fee encompasses a Design License Fee (DLF) of $1,000,000 USD and a Construction License Fee (CLF) of $2,000,000 USD, cumulating in a mandatory total lump sum of $3,000,000 USD. Payment terms will be structured as delineated in the subsequent schedule.
more professional and legit

Royalty Fee Mandate: The remittance shall constitute a Design License Fee (DLF) amounting to $1,000,000 USD and a Construction License Fee (CLF) totaling $2,000,000 USD, aggregating to an obligatory lump sum of $3,000,000 USD. Payment modalities are to be adhered to as stipulated in the definitive fee schedule.

Fix it all and keep it terse, professional, confident and clear:
and 2,000,000 for Construction License Fee for a total lump sum of 3,000,000 USD, to be paid as follows:
Lump sum of 500,000 USD (half of the Design License Fee) to be paid after completing the pilot study by the First Party.  during the process of the development of the design.  Full payment will be delivered to the Second Party after submitting plans and specs to the First Party.
Lump sum of 500,000 USD upon the approval of the final design by an Independent International Consultant commissioned by the Client. 

The remaining balance of the royalty fee (Construction License Fee) shall be paid on a pro-rata basis, corresponding proportionally to the total contract value, as payments are received by Party One throughout the term of this agreement, as further detailed in the Definitions section herein. By way of illustration, should Party One receive a payment of 5 million USD, representing 3.33% of a total 150 million USD contract value, an equivalent 3.33% of the remaining balance shall be disbursed, continuing in this manner until the full balance is settled by the conclusion of the agreement term.

Royalty Fee Structure: The royalty encompasses a $1,000,000 USD Design License Fee (DLF) and a $2,000,000 USD Construction License Fee (CLF), totaling an obligatory $3,000,000 USD. Payment terms are as follows:

1. An initial $500,000 USD (half of DLF) post-completion of the pilot study by the First Party, during design development. Full DLF settlement upon submission of plans and specifications to the First Party.
2. A subsequent $500,000 USD upon final design approval by an Independent International Consultant appointed by the Client.

The residual CLF will be discharged pro-rata, aligned with total contract value receipts by the First Party, as detailed in the Definitions. For instance, a 3.33% contract payment received by Party One corresponds to a similar percentage of the remaining CLF, continuing until the agreement's culmination.
No acronyms

Royalty Fee Structure: The royalty includes a $1,000,000 Design License Fee and a $2,000,000 Construction License Fee, amounting to a required total of $3,000,000. Payment schedule is as follows:

1. An initial $500,000 (half of the Design License Fee) upon completion of the pilot study by the First Party, concurrent with ongoing design development. The remaining Design License Fee is due upon the First Party's receipt of complete plans and specifications.
2. A subsequent $500,000 upon final design approval by an Independent International Consultant engaged by the Client.

The balance of the Construction License Fee will be paid on a pro-rata basis, reflecting proportionate payments to the total contract value, as received by the First Party throughout the term of this agreement. For example, if the First Party receives a payment representing 3.33% of a total $150 million contract value, an equivalent 3.33% of the remaining Construction License Fee will be paid, continuing in this manner until fully settled by the end of the term.
can you return the example in the last paragraph yet make it pro

The remainder of the Construction License Fee will be settled proportionately, aligning with incremental contract value receipts by the First Party, as elucidated in the agreement's definitions. Illustratively, if the First Party receives a payment that constitutes 3.33% of the total $150 million contract value, an equivalent 3.33% of the outstanding Construction License Fee will be disbursed. This methodical disbursement will persist correspondingly with each contract installment received, ensuring complete settlement by the term's conclusion.
while mantaining cashflow for the project

The balance of the Construction License Fee shall be methodically disbursed in alignment with the contract's payment milestones, ensuring a steady cash flow for the project. For instance, should the First Party receive a payment representing 3.33% of the total $150 million contract value, a commensurate 3.33% of the outstanding Construction License Fee will be paid. This proportional payment strategy will maintain project liquidity and continue until the entire fee is settled by the agreement's end.
